profileText: A Representative from Minnesota; born in St. Paul, Ramsey County, Minn., May 5, 1911; graduated from St. John's College Preparatory High School, Collegeville, Minn., 1930; attended St. John's University, Collegeville, Minn., 1930-1932; LL.B., University of North Dakota, Grand Forks, N. Dak., 1935; B.S.C., University of North Dakota, Grand Forks, N. Dak., 1938; lawyer, private practice; professor; municipal judge, East Grand Forks, Minn., 1935-1939; assistant attorney general, Office of the Attorney General, State of Minnesota, 1939-1942; United States Navy, 1942-1946; elected as a Republican to the Eightieth Congress (January 3, 1947-January 3, 1949); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Eighty-first Congress in 1948; probate judge, Ramsey County, Minn., 1950-1954; United States district judge for the district of Minnesota, 1954-1958, chief judge, 1958-1992; died on March 2, 1992, in St. Paul, Minn.

researchRecord.name: 1925-1992, 14.75 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The Edwart Devitt Papers contain correspondence, reports, committee records, speech files, legal opinions, newspaper clippings, magazine articles, scrapbooks, photographs, and other papers documenting Devitt's career as a U.S. district court judge from St. Paul (Minn.). The papers also contain information on Devitt's congressional career and include anniversary correspondence, appointment certificates, speech transcripts, published articles, legal opinions, and scrapbooks relating to his political and judicial career. The majority of the collection documents Devitt's professional activities in legal organizations. Sections of particular interest include the American Bar Association's Fair Trial-Free Press Committee, the Judicial Standards Committee of the Judicial Conference of the U.S., and the Devitt Distinguished Service to Justice Award presented annually by West Pub. Co. (St. Paul). A container list is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: 1927-1992, 57.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The Edward J. Devitt Papers consist of biographical materials, memorabilia, and other items not filed under specific court cases, 1927-1992. The papers also contain files for criminal and civil cases heard by Judge Devitt. Fifteen photographs were separated and added to the Orin G. Libby Photograph Collection. An inventory is available in the repository and online.
